channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9539] Handle post namespace snapshot files when checking for HFile V1
item.description:
When checking for HFileV1 before upgrading to 96, the snapshot file links tries to read from post-namespace locations. The migration script needs to be run on 94 cluster, and it requires reading the old (94) layout to check for HFileV1.


Got exception while reading trailer for file: hdfs://xxx:41020/cops/cluster_collection_events_snapshot/2086db948c484be62dcd76c170fe0b17/meta/cluster_collection_event=42037b88dbc34abff6cbfbb1fde2c900-c24b358ddd2f4429a7287258142841a2

java.io.FileNotFoundException: Unable to open link: org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.HFileLink locations=[hdfs://xxx:41020/hbase-96/data/default/cluster_collection_event/42037b88dbc34abff6cbfbb1fde2c900/meta/c24b358ddd2f4429a7287258142841a2, hdfs://xxx:41020/hbase-96/.tmp/data/default/cluster_collection_event/42037b88dbc34abff6cbfbb1fde2c900/meta/c24b358ddd2f4429a7287258142841a2, hdfs://xxx:41020/hbase-96/archive/data/default/cluster_collection_event/42037b88dbc34abff6cbfbb1fde2c900/meta/c24b358ddd2f4429a7287258142841a2]
item.summary: Handle post namespace snapshot files when checking for HFile V1

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: The fix would be to add pre-namespace paths in the link so that when we try to open the reader, it would look at older positions.

Patch which adds the pre-namespace paths. Tested it on a dataset with snapshot files and it works good.

mvn test -Dtest=TestUpgrade*,TestNamespace* passes.

This message is automatically generated.

Would suggest better names for the constants in DOT_ARCHIVE and DOT_TMP otherwise folks will ask why you are not using what is in HConstants. Call it PRE_NS_DOT_ARCHIVE or something like that?

Some more comments on what is going on – that you are doctoring the return from HFileLink so that refers to pre_ns locations – would help.

This is intended?

  • if (upgrade) {
    + else if (upgrade) {

Does this make it so this tool only works against pre-0.96 snapshot layout? (That is probably ok since they should be gone for 0.96).

Nice test.

Yeah, hadoopqa is crazy these times... not you.

Thanks for the review Stack.

Re: naming: These DOT_XXX naming is borrowed from existing code, NameSpaceUpgrade class. But no problem changing them.

Re: +if (upgrade) {
Yes, that is to add mutual exclusive behavior in the upgrade script in the two modes (check and upgrade). I think it is good to have.

Re: more jave doc
Sure, will add more of it.

Does this make it so this tool only works against pre-0.96 snapshot layout?

Not really. This patch adds more paths to look for when we want to open the FileLink (the FileLink takes an array of path to look when opening the link). So, we just add pre-96 snapshot layout in those options, and make it work on a pre-96 layout (we not removing post-96 related paths).

Updated patch with following changes:

a)Added javadoc for the methods that adds pre-namespace paths to the HFileLink;

b) Rename fields DOT_XXX to PRE_NS_DOT_XXX

mvn test -Dtest=TestUpgrade* passes.
+1 Better. Thanks. Lets see what hadoopqa says and will then commit.

Hmmm... I added a rm -rf /tmp/h* to hadoopqa... and ran this again.... seems to be working:

https://builds.apache.org/view/H-L/view/HBase/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7253/console

We'll see.
